title: Same old tricks
body:
After calling for over and over for 20 minutes without being answered and the ailment serious, I decided to call in to the surgery when passing.
Interesting to find that there were no patients at that time whatsoever. Not even a doctor. Of course I was very annoyed as this particular surgery has a history of not answering to patients.
I challenged the staff member as to why. "We could have been dealing with patients" was the response. I replied "were there any patients"? "sometimes there are" came the reply. 
Nervous smirking and scratching the  back of one's neck are often associated with displacing nervous energy when being economical with the truth.
A surgery with such a negative reputation would do well to resolve the issues. The same ones that have previously drawn the attention of the local MP.
I was also disappointed with the waiting time of two weeks for a pointless phone call then a hard push from the staff member  to call I Heart.
 Also interesting that last week I called dozens of times with no answer. My wife, who is not a patient called for me on her phone. Answered immediately. New patients are accepted! Deliberate? You decide.
We pay taxes to maintain our health not to provide jobs for people whose sole intention is to avoid the patient at all costs.

title: Best to email to get an appointment
body: Trying to call the surgery is not a good option got cut off twice after 20min wait.  Got an appointment after receiving my online request much better. Thank you

title: Not  a happy visit
body:
I had an appointment for booster vaccine in Churchill Square
When I arrived was informed that  there would be an hour‚Äôs wait as it was also a walkin clinic.I accept that they were busy but could not those with pre booked slots be fitted in near their appointment times? Certainly would NOT recommend prebooking to anyone.
The volunteer staff were helpful and sympathetic but that did not make my wait any shorter!

title: Absurdly inefficient in communicating with clients
body: The surgery will only follow up with clients through the post. I received a letter requesting that I call the surgery - we don't check our post box every day, so the letter might have been there for a while. When I called the surgery, I was told to try again the next day as "phone appointments" were all taken for the day. I asked why the doctor did not call, text, or email me, and was told the surgery will only contact patients by posting letters. This is absurdly inefficient and I am still incredulous that this is acceptable practice in the NHS.

title: Going downhill
body: This practice continues its descent which began perhaps at the beginning of the pandemic - the ability to see a GP is now next to zero instead heavily relying on so-called "Digital consultation" where  everything you say is recorded and put on your file forever and then an endless parade of back-and-forth digital messages and then you are at the mercy, literally, of a doctor to decide if they want to see you. And all this can take days and has on at least one occasion required a trip to A&E and then escalation (by a teary patient) to a specialist who asked why this had not been seen by the GP in the first place. This GP practice is ashambles

title: Kind and caring
body:
I asked for an appointment and contacted the receptionist who was very kind and caring, arranged a telephone appointment the next day. The GP arranged for me to be seen that day as I needed an urgent review. I received prompt thorough care. I needed further tests urgently which the amazing reception team, did their upmost to arrange. 
In these terrible covid -19 times I was treasured with kindness & compassion when I was feeling particularly unwell and vulnerable. Thank you everyone.

title: Shocking
body:
Ordered my sons insulin but computers went down . So took 5 days to get this sorted. My stepsons has controlled drugs which was ordered last week before the Easter so we had them in time. Had to go 3 days with no med he has adhd.
My daughter needed a inhaler she is 3 and have not given a spacer for her to have this. This doctor‚Äôs surgery should of closed long time ago failing all the patients every day

title: On the up
body:
I hardly ever contacted the surgery and even more so over the last few years due to the lack of empathy, understanding & compassion from certain receptionists when you eventually got through on the dreadful phone system. 
However, credit where credit is due the new ‚Äúring back‚Äù service is brilliant, you do get called back!!
I also want to mention (unfortunately the NHS won‚Äôt allow me to name) the receptionist I spoke to this morning, She has gone ‚Äúabove & beyond‚Äù to try to help me especially after a long bank holiday weekend and the other additional pressures receptionists deal with on a day to day basis!! I hope some of the new partners & receptionists ask you what your secret is and take a leaf out of your book for patient care, dignity and respect at a surgery their own families would be proud of and want to use.

title: Wast of time
body: Will never set foot in this he'll hole again. Got appointment for today follow up after cataract surgery when got to book in was told all cancelled today. Got told would have a phone call to book a new appointment on afternoon. What a shock never got a call it's a  joke of a hospital not wasting my time and money to drive and park there for nothing to happen.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Appointments or lack of
body: I have just queued for an hour to get an appointment which for me is important as it is something I am worried to be told there are no appointments.  No question to whether it was urgent, just it was a no and I could be sent a link to when some become available.  Really disappointing when the surgery has full control of its appointment lists and can make them as available as they wish.  Same as they do not expose routine appointments via NHS app or patient online.  I also want to make a complaint but guess what the website it down.  I am probably going to have to end up going private now as I really need to issue being seen to, I am lucky I can afford to do this, what about those people that can't!  I am really disappointed in the lack of support from a surgery I used to rave about.

title: Good people
body: From being sent from GP it has taken 7 hrs so far. I appreciate it is very busy, but the whole process is incorrectly organised and seems disjointed. There does not seem to be any clear direction for staff. Patients are not kept updated. Surely with all the technology available some sort of visitor/patient application could simplify the whole process

title: Wow! Not in a good way
body:
Shocking
Turned up for smear appointment at a well woman clinic,myself and 2 others sitting,door open,no one on reception,sitting waiting and waiting,in the end one of the woman says she's been in for nearly 45 minutes and seen no one and another says she confirmed the clinic was on just a few hours ago.
So we go knocking on doors,no answer then go and find a cleaner,nice woman who know nothing about it,kindly rang her boss who also knew nothing about it and said someone would be in touch tomorrow.further people could have turned up after us,who knows!
I work for the nhs in primary care and am sad to say can't say am shocked or surprised by this as the system seems to be broken

title: Star Orthopaedic Team
body: After finally being referred by my GP/physio, I saw the orthopaedic surgeon on 6 Dec 2021, the pre-op team on 29 Dec and then the hip replacement operation on 9 Feb 2022.  After being in so much pain, it was a great relief to be immediately out of pain and start to regain my mobility.  The surgeon and team were brilliant as well as all the aftercare I received from the physios and wonderful equipment I was loaned to help in my home.  It was very much appreciated.  Please keep up the good work.

title: No compassion
body:
Our family members have been registered with this surgery since birth. My mum for 86 years. Unfortunately at that age if you need to see a Doctor an appointment in four weeks which was offered today isn't good enough. This is the receptionist who has no compassion or empathy at all. She should not be working for the NHS. Her manner is cold and uncaring. Four weeks ago we were told 'if it's a back problem go to A&E, she might need a scan ' when all that was needed was analgesia for a pulled muscle!  I dread  her answering the phone.
  I am so disappointed, most receptionists and doctors apart from one are pleasant and caring when you get to see them, as are the nurses. The old Doctors who I remember with fondness would be turning in their graves at the way things are now.

title: Phones off, no medication
body:
Don't expect to get anything from this practice. Trying to get medication or an appointment is like pulling teeth, and even when you can get through there's a decent chance they'll muck up your medication (prescribed 150mg of a drug in 100s and 50s? repeat prescriptions will only have one of those tablets included!). They also like turning their phones off or having you wait 20 minutes on the line, so if you've got an emergency you're out of luck. Actually seeing a doctor involves going into an enclosed building with ill people to wait for a possible opening for you, so have fun waiting who knows how long for that. Doctors appointments are a thing of the past, you see. If you're lucky you might be able to call at 8 am for an appointment, but if you've got a condition that makes that difficult, tough luck!

In case it's not obvious, this place is unfit for purpose.

The medical staff, once you get to them, are decent enough. Never had an issue with them. You just can't get to them.

title: Superb Staff, Excellent Experience
body: I cannot recommend 56 Dean Street enough. I was initially hesitant when both the medical professionals were of a different gender to me, especially considering that my issue was to do with sexual health and involved intimate examinations, but what could have been a traumatic medical procedure was handled with such professionalism and care. I have never been treated so well by a medical professional. They talked me through each step of the procedure and at no point did anyone patronise or lecture me. I have had such terrible experiences with doctors and nurses in the past but the staff here genuinely helped to restore my trust in medical professionals. I will be recommending the practice to anyone and everyone and I cannot thank the medical professionals enough for their time, care and professionalism. I have never felt so at ease in a medical situation.

readBy.name: Chelsea and Westminster Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Kenn22
title: Appointment at maternity unit
body: Felt like a number, went for scan same place as booking appointment same again told to wait in lobby only this time no chair been waiting half hour whilst partner is seen to.

author: Myfamily
title: Wonderful Staff
body:
I was diagnosed with cancer at the beginning of April. Everything has moved really fast since.  
I have been very calm since I was told. All the hospital doctors, scan technicians, endoscopy doctor and nurses have been wonderful. I am now in touch with the cancer nurses. I feel really lucky that I have the NHS beside me as myself and family take this trip.  
I also had to attend Louth County Hospital today for a MRI Scan and I was treated very well. I can‚Äôt fault anyone.

author: pegasusse59
title: My son required help and assessment by the crisis team
body:
My son suffers with addiction problems which over the last few months have escalated and become even more difficult.  
For my family and myself this has been unbearable and something none of us have had any experience of. He is getting help from We are With You but this help is very much geared towards the person engaging as as the addiction takes more of a hold the person stops engaging with everything and everyone. As a Healthcare Professional I fix things and help support I could not fix this and this was the hardest bit for me.  
Things ended up in him having withdrawal psychosis and delusions where he was not making sense or able to make decisions, resulting in me having to call an ambulance and seek help. He was admitted through A&E and from stepping through the doors I was grateful for the help he received from every professional in the building. He was assessed by the liaison team who along with the consultant made appropriate decisions around next steps.  
He was admitted for in patient care which gave him a place for his body and brain to recover. It also gave his family breathing space to regain energy and also heal some of the trauma of the past few weeks and with the help of the incredible staff from domestics, HCSW, trained staff, Occupational therapists and consultant a plan was made for him with the amazing help of the addictions team.  
He is now home with help and support from the Community services I am so grateful for the support if everyone.  
Unfortunately addiction does still carry sigma and I just wanted to remind everyone dealing with these patients that with the correct help and support they can find a way forward and the support for their families is essential.  
So thankyou to everyone who was involved in his care without your continued commitment to the service and to your patients the NHS would struggle to support this ongoing crisis.  
Thankyou

author: cvrgraham
title: Poor patient care and management for my mum
body:
My old mum has been in the QEUH for nearly 10 weeks and has got worse since she went in and now on Palliative Care. I believe due to the standards and management of her care and wellbeing she has got worse instead of better and her mental health has dropped like a stone.  
Today was the last straw !  
She‚Äôs now been in 3 wards due to bed shortages and also spent over 26 hours on a trolley bed on admission without anyone diagnosing her problems or even putting her on a drip even though she was dehydrated and not eaten for days before.  
She‚Äôs still not eating much but today asked me to bring her up some lemon sole üêü from my local restaurant.  
I got the guys who I know to make and pack it specially and took it up. She was so looking forward to it.  
It‚Äôs was obviously a bit cold, they have a ward kitchen with a microwave. So I asked very politely and backed it up with stating her diet and eating habits over 9 weeks and asked if I could get a wee plate and heat it up in the microwave?  
It would fairly cheer her up even a mouth full or a taste ?  
An auxiliary and three nurses couldn‚Äôt make the decision about the use of a microwave for 2 minutes. They had to ask whoever was in charge and they said no because it was a health and safety issue üôÑ after one said it shouldn‚Äôt be a problem.  
I was flabbergasted and blew my top saying just get her ready I‚Äôm taking her home right now.  
She could be on her death bed, hasn‚Äôt eaten for 9 weeks, asked me to bring her something up she fancied to eat, which is a miracle in itself, and someone comes up with this stupid decision  
In 10 weeks since admission the care she has had in that hospital has been a joke.  
No one has a clue and the management of patients and staff is unbelievably poor.  
All nice folk but no coordination management of systems that work.  
I‚Äôll be glad to get her out of there ASAP  
Someone needs to have a serious look at how that hospital is run to benefit the patients.  
From admission to getting out it‚Äôs a farce compared to what used to be a great and caring Health Service.  
You cannot get though to speak to anyone the phones ring out for hours.  
When you do speak to someone no one passes on your messages to senior staff or clinicians who you also cannot get in front off as no one in the wards seem to know who‚Äôs on or off as they rotate every two weeks. They don‚Äôt know the secretaries phone numbers to make appointments to see your mum's consultant.  
The senior nursing staff yes, sympathetically listen but then nothing happens.  
From my experience a patient is stuck in a wee room with a crap TV and get a visit every 4 hours or so when a box needs ticked on a form.  
That to me is the extent of patient interaction and care. They follow what is written down by an unseen consultant who you cannot contact.  
I believe my mothers chances of surviving and having any decent standard of life or wellbeing has dramatically been affected by lack of professionalism, logistics, management, bureaucracy and ultimately poor poor care for the patient.  
Most of all she‚Äôs suffered due to inept communication and late diagnosis and prognosis of her condition.  
I hope all I say helps her and others as I feel standards have dropped appallingly.

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Absolute Rubbish
body: Terrible practice. The most incompetent staff and service provided. I‚Äôve never had an appointment or prescription booked or filled in a timely manor and it has costed me countless hours chasing them for any needs.

title: Excellent nurse gave me choice and control
body: Had a very good experience at this community hospital. I needed to come in during a bank holiday for a urine test, and the male nurse I saw was absolutely excellent - he treated me with dignity and respect, was highly knowledgeable, and gave me choice and control over my options for further treatment and/or testing. I felt listened to, respected, and in control. Excellent quality care!

title: Vast improvement needed
body:
This review echoes much of what is said in other reviews and can be summarised as follows:

- Extremely bad telephone system.  Get put in a queue holding often for over an hour. Once took 3 days to get through to someone.
- When you finally get through to the number one spot, you might get cut off upon someone picking up. You cannot keep blaming a telephone system for your staff actively putting down the phone! This has been going on for well over a year now. 
- Reception staff are sometimes not helpful and it feels as if you are bothering them. 
- Upon call back, doctors do not seem to even look at your records before hand and ask you to explain everything from scratch.  Bring up patient records before you call.
- When you have a booked face to face appointment, you are never seen on time.  You are usually waiting at least 30mins. Once waited nearly 2 hours! But yet, there is an attitude to patients if they are 5 minutes late. 

The only thing which saves this surgery is one doctor who is excellent and is the only reason I have not left.

I have sent an email to the practice manager which was ignored and never responded to. That says it all really.

There is no excuse for such continued bad service, which was present before the Corona virus. And it's a shame the bad reviews and emails are not even acted upon.  Patients lives and wellbeing are being affected by this. Stop the excuses and do better!

author: Jaykay53
title: Painful cannula insertion
body:
In early March 2022 I was admitted by my consultant to A&E in Peterborough. After 4 and a half hours of waiting I was taken in and put on a trolley bed and examined. A nurse came to me to take bloods so I put out my left hand. As I have very good veins I thought nothing of it. The next thing I knew the needle really hurt me, and when I looked it was a canula. I asked why a canula had been put right in the middle of my arm where it bends and why I hadn't been told they were putting a cannula in or even been asked.  
As it was I was admitted to MSU for 10 days and that cannula hurt me, especially when the nurses were using it. The nurses in there were so busy that they couldn't even change the site of the cannula, and I didn't want to push them as I could see how busy and short staffed they were. When I was transferred to a Ward eventually 10 days later it came up as a lump and I was in so much pain. The nurse kindly changed the site of the canula.  
I was discharged 19 days later and had to go to out patients for another blood test. The Phlebotomist could not use the vein which I had been using without any problem for several years as it had gone so hard. They had to use the other hand and told me not to use that very hand for blood test for several weeks as it needed to be rested.  
It's a good thing that I have very good veins otherwise I would have had problems giving a bloods in future and I hope no one gets treated the same way as I did. That site still hurts me when I touch it 40 days later. I am a diabetic and suffering from Heart failure and I have had double organ transplants, so I have had several cannulas and blood tests over the years without a problem whatsoever.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: What a poor practice
body:
You spend up to 2 hours getting through 35 minutes getting in to the que then up to an hour and 15 minutes to get through to recpetionists.

You cant get a face to face appointment unless the doctor brings you in after a phone appointment if you have no phone your out of luck here 

When doctors forget to call ypu back or you have a complaint the fob you off to email them.

No practice manager onsite and they wont even cal them so you can talk to them. very unprofessional so dont hold hopes on complaint

Besides the actual doctors and nurses who are polite and professional. 
 the receptionists ask us to treat them with respect but treat you like dirt and when your not happy say calm down dont have a go or you wil not be served. Treat patients better and we will respect you.

This surgery needs to offer the choice when you ring and wait to get through from up to 2 hours wait 

Allow people to walk in to see if theres a doctor they can see 

Let us choose to either have a phone call or actually see a gp face to face again. 

Also sort out your extremley attroucious phones instead of telling every one to ring at the same times at either 8am or 1pm so people arent spending ¬£10 to 15 amonth just contacting your gp

Kingsbury court yes its a court alright the reception booth is run buy jesters.

title: Econsult
body: Tried to use econsult, not fit for purpose told me I need a doctor immediately, rubbish I just want a prescription changed. Tried other of the Web site headings, even more ridiculous suggestions, hense the only way to contact the surgery is through complaints. Crazy because when you eventually speak to a member of staff they are amazingly helpful. Get rid of this Internet rubbish.

title: Professional and caring gp
body: Visted the surgery twice within a month. The Gp was very attentive, took time to listen, suggested treatment. A very caring Gp.

title: No way to get through
body: Awaiting my health records for a mortgage completion , over 3 months now, and now response. About to lose my offer. Absolute joke

title: Amazing Team
body:
Having recently moved to the local area from the midlands we found ourselves needing to visit the Urgent Care Centre at Tiverton. The quality of service and care were very impressive, it was refreshing to see professionals enjoy the work they do and care about the patients/visitors experience. 

We arrived quite late in the evening, the receptionist on duty was very pleasant and went out of her way to ask one of the nurses to assist us with a delicate matter which was dealt with discretely instead of having to speak out loud in front of other patients. We appreciated this very much, we were also seen in a timely manner.

Thank you all a Tiverton Urgent Care Unit, you get 5 Stars from my wife and I. Keep up the exemplary work!

readBy.name: South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

title: Kind and professional
body: I go for blood tests regularly at this practice, one nurse in particular excels at her job. My veins are quite deep and not always easy to find, but this nurse is the only person who always finds the vein first time, I‚Äôve had nurses give up in the past so this is quite impressive.  She takes the time to put her patients at ease. While chatting during a previous visit I mentioned that I was feeling down as I had put quite a bit a weight on during lockdown, so she put me forward for a weight loss program. She definitely goes the extra mile for her patients! Thanks B-J

title: Unhelpful reception staff and a rude doctor
body: I am so glad that I am not a patient of this practice. I had to take my 11 year old son here for a celiacs blood test because they don't do them at our GPs. When the doctor called us in he asked me for the labels in an extremely rude manner and said he couldn't do the test without them. When I told him I wasn't given any he simply shrugged his shoulders. It wasn't until I rang my practice who told him they'd been sent that he decided to do the test. My son is afraid of needle's and this man made him feel worse! He then demanded that I go and collect the labels from my doctor's right away as he couldn't find them. He didn't even attempt to apologize and treated us as an inconvenience. The reception staff were very ignorant and also didn't attempt to look for the labels. Avoid!

title: Not rushed
body: I was with the practitioner for almost an hour.  At no point did I feel rushed or like an inconvenience, which sadly is the way I feel at most GP visits.  My examination was thorough and holistic.  Time was taken to help me understand my perceived condition and it was clearly explained that a referral would be made to my own GP for a diagnosis.  The practitioner seemed mindful of the information that he was giving me and how this might be interpreted, taking the time to make sure that I fully understood what was being conveyed.

title: Poor administration
body:
I was hospitalised by Covid and on discharge the hospital notified my GP who asked me to make an appointment which I did.

 A telephone appointment was arranged. The GP called me on my mobile but due to poor service where I live, the call went straight to voicemail. The GP didn‚Äôt call my landline (which they‚Äôve had on record for years) but left a voicemail asking me to call back but didn‚Äôt give a direct dial number. My only choice was to call the generic surgery number which, because this was an 0730 appointment, went to voicemail telling me to call back after 0800 when the surgery opened. I called back at 0800 and was told I was 47th in the queue! I gave up. 

Why didn‚Äôt the GP call my landline? Why didn‚Äôt the GP leave a direct dial number for me to return the call? 

Poor administration resulting in unnecessary extra demand on an already stretched service.

title: Very caring
body: It can be difficult to get through to reception via telephone, but when you do the staff are very friendly sympathetic and listen, if they can give you a appointment space they do. The Dr's are very caring listen to your needs and are professional.

title: Impossible to get an appointment
body: Trying to book an appointment. Every time I call, I'm in a queue with 20+ before me. Look online and there are no appointments available in the month period - the maximum time you can select in the date range. I'm overdue a medication review, a 6montly/annual blood test. I don't want to be dramatic and demand a same day appointment but it is looking like I have no option. No reminder, I appreciate this might have been due to COVID. I am seriously considering registering with a different practice.

title: Excellent practice
body: Thank you to everybody who works at Witterings Medical Centre for your kindness and efficiency over the past two difficult years. I have needed lots of help and you responded quickly and professionally. If I rang you in the morning by lunch time I had spoken to a doctor and either been given an appointment, medication or referral as needed. It can't have been easy for any of you during Covid. But you were always available and caring. Nurses dressed my wounds with kindness and humour. Doctors listened to my woes and sorted out my treatments. Receptionist and back office answered my enquiries and requests with patience and charm. I could not have wished for better care from you all. I am very grateful for your dedication and count myself lucky that I and my family are under you care.

title: Superb receptionist
body: I am not allowed to mention names or gender in this review; I just wanted to acknowledge publicly the fact that one of the receptionists in this practice is the most helpful, caring and committed person anyone can hope for when walking into a surgery. Thank you!

title: Efficient
body: I was seen by the drs and had a blood test the same day. Results back within 24 hours and prescribed medications within 48 hours of initial visit.

title: Two kind and caring ladies
body:
My husband was taken to The Christie hospital in Manchester. We were taken by ambulance by too lovely ladies.
They were very attentive and put us at our ease.
It was an excellent service.

title: Fantastic service and Treatment
body: Attened this service related to injuries connected to ill mental health. From walking in the door I was seen by triage within 5 minutes, and then again seen by a clinician within 5 minutes following this. All members of staff treated me with full respect, care and support and for the duration of receiving my treatment continued to ensure I was OK throughout. I would highly recommend this service and cannot praise the staff highly enough. Thank you to all who treated me.

title: Good GP practice
body: Now that the pandemic normality is now returning to having face- to-face consultations this is good but in many cases a early phone call with the GP is sufficient. It does however depend on the patient. If it‚Äôs to get results which are clear then a phone call may be all that is needed.

title: Professional end to end
body: Professional and speedy (very), you could sense the pride and knowledge with which the staff operate in delivering an outstanding service. Had been bothered by my condition for a couple of years that was not totally been sorted out, but within a few days after referral had all the necessary tests and results and a plan forward, thankfully got my life back, sounds dramatic but that‚Äôs what it feels like. Thank you

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Radiology Department Excellence
body: I attended a day patient procedure in the radiation department.  I want to express my gratitude to all in the department for their professionalism, expertise, information, kindness, and respect for me. The department is, without a doubt, staffed by expert, caring people. Thank you.

title: Appointments let them down
body: The practice is good, not the best, not the worse. The GPS are knowledgeable and explain things well and do genuinely want to help you. However, the thing that lets this practice down is it‚Äôs appointment availability and reception team. The team seem nice and frustrated at some of the systems, however when you‚Äôre spending days in the condition you are in before you‚Äôre even getting an appointment isn‚Äôt acceptable. Calling the practice at 8:00 on the dot is a ritual in the morning when you are sick, even if you are there a second after 8 the main menu will be slow and you‚Äôll be about 15 in the queue somehow. And even though it‚Äôs 8:00 and the practice has just opened after 20 mins on hold your greeted with the normal ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt have any appointments available anymore, please fill in our online e-consult form‚Äù which while is a good enough system it makes no attempt to explain to the person filling it out how it‚Äôs triaged, or how it‚Äôs even handled. An e-consult form is good for people with good digital literacy but doesn‚Äôt reassure people, doesn‚Äôt make it so the person is less scared or anxious about going into the surgery for whatever they are going in for. The surgery in the last few years has gone from one I‚Äôm proud of going too to now one I dread calling, one I dread going too as the wait times are long and unexplained at times. The gps have good bedside manner, they make you calmer and less scared for the situation you‚Äôre in. However the reception team seem to fall down on it, I don‚Äôt want to bring anyone down but it‚Äôs just not good enough in my opinion. I really hope the surgery can sort out their appointment system as most people I talk too have the same opinion, the surgery is good but falls down on basic service standards.

title: Great service
body: As a fellow doctor (PICU SPR) I know how hard general practice is working at the moment, but I must say, I have always had great interactions and advice from my GPS in this practice - EVEN during the pandemic! Even though the last 2 appointments were over the phone, they were thorough and efficient. Investigations were ordered & occurred quite soon afterwards. I also had discussions about the results!! I can only say - keep up the amazing work!! I know how hard you work and it is greatly appreciated!!!

title: Great practice
body:
very good surgery . I've always had good experiences with all the doctors I've seen . They've been helpful compassionate and supportive and helped me find a solution if possible or referred me on if needed 
reception staff are very nice , understanding and try to help all they can . if I've needed medication it has always been prescribed straight away . I've never had to wait . I ve heard alot complaining about not getting an appointment.  if you phone up dead on 8.30 you are almost guaranteed to get an appointment on that day and if it is qn emergency they will always fit you in 
Good surgery would highly recommend

title: Staff genuinely care
body: I've been with this GP practice for over 3 years, and have always been very pleased with their care. All the staff are kind, courteous, and knowledgeable. They do their best to find the right sort of appointment whether that's by phone or in person, with a nurse practitioner or GP. My whole family were well cared for throughout lockdown, and the practice worked tirelessly to find a careful balance between covid safety and patient care. I have every confidence that when I have a health issue (of which I have many) the staff at Kingsbridge will provide the best care possible.

title: Friendly staff
body:
Staff are friendly and helpful.
The surgery is very clean and well looked after.

Well done to you all.

author: Harver1
title: COVID vaccines cancellation
body:
My 2 children received appointments for vaccines on Sunday. We spent the day trying to do some fun things to take their minds off the jab as they were both anxious. Upon arrival to the vaccination centre, we discovered that it was closed. There were some other people arriving for appointments as well. Someone called the appointment booking line and the helpful lady managed to find out that the centre had not been opened that day but no-one knew why. I then had 2 psyched up kids and no vaccines.  
I telephoned today to reschedule and was told no kids appointments were available and even though the appointment we had was cancelled by the NHS, I am now expected to continue to call every few days to try to rearrange these appointments.  
I find it really bad that we weren't contacted to cancel our appointments, there was no notification at the centre as to what was happening and now I am expected to waste my time calling to try to get new appointments (and will also need to psyche my kids up again too!)

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Cc99
title: Fantastic care from every member of staff
body: I attended A&E with my son after he started suffering with chest pains. A&E was incredibly busy and staff were obviously rushed off their feet however the care that my son received was brilliant. The nurses who saw him in triage, the student nurse who did his ECG and the doctor in A&E were just amazing. We were sent to the children‚Äôs ward where the fantastic care continued, all nurses and doctors who saw him were brilliant! I also want to say thank you to the friendly porters for their service. Thank you all for making this scary experience better.

author: BJohn1994
title: The doctor and nurses were lovely
body: I was really apprehensive about having the coil removed as I had a bad experience having it fitted however the doctor and nurses were lovely and helped me to feel prepared and settled

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Professional and kind staff
body: I am so impressed with how professional and kind the staff are here in lurgan. I can easily get very impatient and irritated when I am in hospital although I feel so relaxed here at lurgan and the nurses are always so friendly and so chatty which is always great as it can get a bit boring sometimes. The food is not bad at all and I really enjoy the breakfast. My room is always spotless and i am very thankful for that.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Woodysmum
title: Left feeling unsafe and unclean
body:
I was unfortunate to spend 4 days in York Hospital following gynaecological surgery. The surgery went fine, I recommend the surgical team.  
The hospital environment and nursing care was abysmal. I was not aware that all wards at York Hospital are mixed sex, even for gynaecological and breast cancer surgery. I was shocked to be on a mixed sex ward, with men free to wander into the female bay and men using a female lavatory. One night a man, who had entered the female bay several times during the day, came into the female area and assaulted one of the women, threatened the rest and attacked nursing staff. I did not feel that I was in a safe environment. If I had known in advance that all wards were mixed sex, I would have requested a different hospital or had to have my urgent operation at a private hospital. In addition, I was given the wrong I.V. antibiotics and refused pain relief related to this, discharged with a dressing marked with the extent of post-surgery infection. My dressing wasn‚Äôt changed whilst I was in hospital and I was not given any dressings to take home. There did not appear to be any shower facilities on the ward. I left hospital feeling dirty and infected. I was given conflicting information regarding food, for 2 days I was told that I should have brought my own food in with me. I was provided with food on my last day.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Communication is great
body: Lurgan hospital is so peaceful and I feel as though the nurses are so so caring, they always do their very best and god help them as they are so over worked. The cleanliness is just great the cleaners should be very proud of how hard they work. The food is lovely, my expectations were not very high but I must say the food is great. Communication with the nurses is amazing, they are always letting me know about any small achievements and improvements I am making which definitely motivates me.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: encryptionmp89
title: I was washing my hands over 50 times a day
body:
Due to COVID, I was diagnosed with OCD. I was washing my hands over 50 times a day. I didn't want to go out. I stopped seeing my Friends. I would wash all the shopping that came into the house. I wouldn't use a shopping trolley, the list goes on and on.  
I started to have weekly counseling sessions with Victor and he was really helpful, talking me through steps to help me change my thinking towards COVID and how I was looking and thinking about people and their actions towards COVID. I know I still have a way to go, but today I am not washing my hands as much and I have started to see my friends and make plans for the future with my family and friends.  
I wouldn't have been able to do this without the help of Victor. I am so grateful for his support through this.  
One thing I was told at the start was that you have to want to make the changes yourself and push yourself and this will make you feel uncomfortable. But as long as you have the support of your family and friends, you will be able to get through it.  
Talking to someone who isn't family or a friend, really helps. They make you feel like you are not alone in this and other people have gone through it too.  
I really can't thank you Victor enough, for the help and support he has given me.

title: No way to see a GP
body:
The reception staff is lovely and helpful, but sadly that's where the positives end.

There is no way to book advanced appointments, which means that unless you're very ill on the day and the practice has room, you can't get a routine visit for chronic conditions unless you basically take annual leave from your work and hope for the best.

Quite appalling.

title: Phone system
body: The phone system needs to be fixed? You ring and you get cut off this kept repeating for nearly 30 mins then finally I got though only to be told there‚Äôs no appointments‚Ä¶. This happens most days I‚Äôm not the only person to moan about this

author: OuchMouse
title: Lack of care in A & E
body:
I had a pretty severe case of tonsillitis. In the end, I have two different bacteria infections and glandular fever but that took a while to figure out.  
I called my GP multiple times to let them know the antibiotics weren‚Äôt working (not surprising since I actually had a viral infection) and was told to just keep pushing through.  
I ended up in Ninewells A&E after my fever got out of control and I kept vomiting. A&E itself was hell. I was retching and feeling my fever spiking, watching doctors walk back and forth. After 3 hours, I was finally seen by a doctor. They essentially told me the same thing: Go home and suffer.  
Two days later and I can‚Äôt swallow or breathe. I went back to Ninewells A&E. They said they were very busy. When I arrived there were 5 people waiting including me. It took them over 5 hours to see us. At one point, a woman in a wheelchair asked for help going to the toilet and the nurse asked what was wrong with her in a rude tone.  
I end up admitted to ward 5 at Ninewells. While on the admissions ward, I overheard staff talking about how A&E had only run half the blood panels they should have.  
They discharged me the next day before my blood work came back and with exactly the same treatment plan as before.  
At the advice of 111, I was back in hospital (this time at Victoria Kirkcaldy) in less than 12 hours - once again unable to take my medicine, unable to swallow and my fever creeping up. I saw a very good Out of Hours nurse and then was sent to wait in A&E. I was seated on a bench beside the loudest door imaginable from 3am to 5am. In that time, I listened to staff joke about not washing their hands between seeing patients and eating food and how the they‚Äôd had an easy night. By the time I was allowed to lie down (I say allowed because I was seated directly across from an empty bay) I was ‚Äúdreaming In confetti‚Äù - micro sleeps with very vivid dreams.  
The nurses at every step have been kind and attentive but the doctors just did not seem to care. They have their minds filled with the heart attack patients and the ‚Äúserious‚Äù stuff. They forget that when a person can‚Äôt sleep, it takes about 2 days for the hallucinations to start; that not eating can cause serious complications in combination with some medicines; that being at 7/10 pain for 7 days in a row is so bad for health.  
The senior doctor who is going to make the decision to discharge me in about an hour didn‚Äôt even touch my throat or ask me if I was eating. He looked in my mouth (without a torch) and declared good enough. It was callous.  
I realise that I am not literally dying but I have reached the point where my symptoms run the risk of inflicting unnecessary and long lasting effects.

readBy.name: Office of Murdo Fraser, MSP for Mid Scotland & Fife

author: Disneyfan16
title: Effective antiviral treatment
body:
Having Covid is scary for me as a family member died from Covid. I would recommend the antiviral medication to those it‚Äôs available to. I had IV treatment as I was unable to have oral treatment. The staff on CMDU were amazing, very kind, caring, attentive and happy to answer any questions.  
I was struggling with breathing beforehand, chest tightness, bad cough. The antiviral medication helped with this within 6 hours of having it. I was amazed. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I still feel awful but I know not as bad as before the antiviral medication. Thank you so much to the team, you are doing a great job

author: Sim11
title: Amazing care
body:
I recently had some minor surgery at Clinic 12 at Kings Mill. The Doctor took time to explain the procedure to me and double checked I was sure I wanted to proceed. The nurses were absolutely fantastic! They were so reassuring, kept me distracted, made me laugh and held my hand when I experienced pain. I believe their names were Jeanette and Sally. On previous visits they were exactly the same!  
Thank you so much for the support and reassurance. I honestly can not recommend the team enough.

author: MATTgreg.1997
title: The wonderful staff and medics helped me so much
body:
I was blue lighted from home at the end of March with Atrial Fibrillation. I was so frightened. My sons were allowed into A&E with me, but on admission to Ward 32 because of Covid 19 they were not allowed.  
On admission to the ward my anxiety and fear remained but what can I say about the staff ........... they were totally amazing. They talked to me constantly reassuring me as the A&E staff had given me a worst case scenario. Ward 32 was second to none - nothing was too much trouble for them. I was isolated to a sideroom at one point - they remained calm, caring and diligent  
All in all I was in for 13 days. The wonderful staff and medics helped me so much. I am in awe of them they saved my life xxx

author: Lynbird
title: Unsatisfactory discharge of patient
body:
My husband was discharged on the Saturday of a Bank Holiday weekend after nearly a month in hospital following a lymphoma diagnosis, Covid infection and heart problems. No medical team member spoke to me about his condition or what to expect. We were given no discharge sheet and all his medications, both current and discontinued ones, were put in a bag together, with no information about what he was taking, when and what dosages.  
He left with an open pressure sore but no dressings, treatment or advice for it. We were given no details for anyone to contact for support as I take on a full caring role due to his condition. We both feel very let down and if it wasn‚Äôt for friends in the medical profession, we would have been in real difficulties.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Famrh85
title: You are all amazing!
body: My family would like to recognise the exceptional care that our Dad received in ward 4D in the Ulster hospital during his final days. Every single member of staff that we encountered (domestic services, HCA's, nurses and medical staff) treated our Dad with compassion, respect and dignity. As a family we felt that we were always kept informed and involved in Dad's care and we felt very well supported throughout Dad's stay. You are all amazing! Thank-you

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Internut
title: A very professional job
body: Went to Selby Hospital North Yorkshire to have my blood sample taken. I have had this done many, many times in the past but on this occasion I did not feel a thing. I have very poor veins in my arms and they tend to hide from needles. This lady nurse called Maureen proceeded to put a thin tourniquet around my upper arm which no-one has ever offered to do in the past. I would like to thank this lady for a very professional job well done....

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Ritchie
title: Cardiac Rehabilitation Exercise Class
body: I attended a 6 week Cardiac Rehabilitation Exercise Class which I found extremely useful and beneficial to my health and wellbeing. I cannot state enough how professional the exercise classes were conducted and how beneficial the information was for me.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Very good care
body: My care in the hospital has been very good since I arrived. The nurses are very nice and all are incredible at their job. They are also very helpful and understand how difficult being in hospital especially at a time like Easter can be for us patients. They are very empathetic and give us quality care that makes us feel a lot better. I feel at times the doctors could and need to be more informative. I feel like their communication is at times lacking and they are often very reluctant to tell me a lot of things which can cause issues as I am sometimes left unsure of where my treatment is going. The food is usually okay and I always get enough to eat. Everything is very well cleaned and I am glad they usually use odourless cleaning supplies meaning we don‚Äôt smell bleach the whole day

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Gauld/Anderson
title: Helpful staff for radiology appointment
body:
Arrived in car park to find no spaces. Went to take my 93 year old father out of car to sit at back doors/entrance, when we were approached by a young man called Armani (?). He asked if we had a blue disabled badge, which we did. He kindly removed some cones to let us into a disability space. He also took over a wheelchair and pushed my dad to the orange ward. The staff in the radiology ward were caring and friendly and made my anxious father relax.  
Well done to the nurses and Armani. Thank you.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Fifes95
title: Implantation of Pacemaker
body:
[Very happy with 'Reception']  
[Very happy with 'Environment']

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Couldn't ask for better care
body: I couldn‚Äôt ask for better care and also if given the chance I could never stop talking about how amazing the ladies and gentlemen that take care of me are and how grateful ion am to them. The doctors and nurses are absolutely incredible as well as the fantastic domestics and assistants. The only issue I have is that they are not paid more for their fantastic service. I understand everything they tell me and as someone who likes to know what‚Äôs going on I ask a lot of questions which they always have more than enough time and effort for which is credit to their professionalism. The food has been really good and has improved a lot since I was in over a year age. I always get enough and I always enjoy what I get. The staff are fantastic at cleaning and honestly never seem to stop. I would also like to send a big thank you to the paramedics in the ambulance who helped with my admission to hospital as well as the staff who were waiting for me on arrival. I have had no issues with my care and am very grateful for the care I have received it has been truly wonderful

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Steve0412
title: Every single aspect of my care was excellent
body:
A week on from my hip-replacement surgery at St Michael's, Hayle, I'd like to express my most sincere thanks to all involved in my stay - their expertise was very much appreciated. Every single aspect of my care was excellent and all encountered were so kind and professional - at reception, on the ward, in pre-op, theatre, post-op, at x-ray...  
Please note also that all support aspects prior to surgery were brilliant.  
Many thanks

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My care in the hospital has been vey good
body: My care in the hospital has been very good. The nurses have been truly brilliant as well as the healthcare assistants and honestly any staff I come into contact with in the ward have been exceptional at their job. They are very nice and will always take me outside in the morning so that I can get some fresh air and anything from the shop that I may need. This is also good as it helps me get my independence back as I now feel like I need the wheelchair less and less after this illness hit me very suddenly which was very scary but thanks to the treatment I have received I am feeling a lot more at ease about everything. The doctors have been exceptional so far and have made things very easy to understand. This is due to their exceptional explanation. The food I have not been as fussed on it however it has been edible so far and I always get enough so I can‚Äôt really complain. The place is very clean thanks to the fanatic domestic Tracy who never stops cleaning. I have had no issues at all and am grateful for my care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My care has been brilliant
body: My care has been brilliant and I have enjoyed the treatment that I have received on the ward. The nurses as well as all the staff I have had the pleasure of coming into contact with have been so helpful. They all care so much and make everything I ask easy to understand not directing it at a level too high or low for me to understand. The food is good however I feel at times there is a lack of variety of flavours and there needs to be more of a choice of flavours e.g. sweet sour etc. The portions are also very large which can lead to some issues in the waste. Apart from this I honestly could not say a bad word about any part of the hospital as it has been exceptional however I am very excited to be discharged and get home

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Care in the hospital is incredible
body: My care in the hospital has been incredible and this is due to the fact that all of the staff are absolutely exceptional at their job. You can tell by watching how professional, experienced and knowledgeable they truly are. They are also so attentive always doing things such as little check-ups and conversation which takes my mind of being in hospital. My surgery was first class and it was truly exceptional how at ease the anestishits has me before the surgery something I was previously very worried about. After surgery it took me a long time to come around however when I did the recovery word was a pleasant experience and I found it to be excellent. The food is not so good due to the time it takes the food to get here it is often slightly cold and some things often stick to the plate making it difficult to eat. I am very happy with how clean the ward is which has dramatically reduced my fears. I am very happy with my nurses and my doctors who have made things so easy to understand and have meant my stay in hospital has had no issues

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff are superb
body: My care in the hospital has been very good. The staff have been absolutely superb in taking care of me and that is absolutely every member of staff from the domestics to the doctors they all take such good care with their attentive nature. I feel like in the hospital us as patients are put first which just adds to the world class care we are given. They are also so easy to understand and direct everything at my level as well as answering my questions. The food has been very good so far and I enjoy every meal and always get more than enough to eat. I love how clean everything is it makes me feel a lot safer as the sheets are comfortable and I don‚Äôt have to worry about infection. I have had no issues and have thought the way I have been traded has been exceptional.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Willh
title: Wonderful staff in fracture clinic
body: Wonderful staff in fracture clinic. Dealing with a huge patient load patiently, professionally and kindly.

author: JMcD
title: Be proud of the work you do, it really matters
body:
Huge thank you to Dr Jafferbhoy and his team, particularly Shelly, Lead CNS in Gastroenterology for the care given to our 93 year old mother over the last few months as she suffered a flare up of her ulcerative colitis. This has been a distressing time for her and her family as she struggled with her bowel symptoms whilst also suffering from cognitive decline. Shelly‚Äôs communication was excellent with the family and mum, guiding us through medication changes and endoscopy procedures. She really listened and dealt with our concerns about mum, adapting treatment when it affected mum‚Äôs cognition.  
I can‚Äôt thank her and the team involved enough for their kindness and care. Mum is finally on the recovery path and coping more easily with life. It is teams like you who are standard bearers for NHS Scotland, be proud of the work you do, it really matters.  
Thanks again.

author: tauruszb58
title: Waiting time for X-ray
body: I attended Maxiofacial almost a year after being referred on several occasions by my dentist, they require a CT scan before they can treat further I was assured this would happen at FVR by the doctor yet I was offered an appointment elsewhere which I had to refuse. I have tried contacting radiology to get an idea when my appointment will be as I have to let the doctor know once it has been done. The answer machine says leave your name and number and we will get back to you at the end it says don't leave a message. I have waited so long for this treatment and it is causing me such distress and all that's holding it up is a CT scan.

title: Worst Practice
body: Unfriendly staff especially at reception they see you and take ages before someone comes to deal with you, they always seem to be in rush to get rid you and don‚Äôt give you time to speak or explain something. Staff lack communication and listening skills with patients and with each other. One staff tells you one thing, next min another staff says something completely different giving you the run around. Please don‚Äôt come back with a response with stats and how busy you are, the practice was empty when I went in, you have moved almost all the service online and hardly do face to face interaction, the little face to face interaction you do is really poor service

author: Georgiegirl
title: Lovely and supportive staff in A&E
body: I was in A&E QMC Nottingham after falling and fracturing my wrist. I would just like to praise the staff working that day for their professionalism and support that I received. As a fellow healthcare worker I could see how pressurised the environment was but noted that all staff maintained their composure and expertise which made my experience so much better. I am annoyed that I can't remember the names of the nurses that helped me that day as I wanted to pass on my sincere thanks for their support. They were lovely. I also thought the doctor that had to manipulate my wrist was brilliant. Thank you.

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: They explain everything for us
body:
My daughter cannot remember accident and emergency or the ambulance ride in, I have to say they were brilliant.  
Daisy ward is good, the privacy is good for my daughter as she is at the age of independence, and the private rooms and en-suite are outstanding. They explain everything for us and they constantly check to ensure we are okay.  
The staff are brilliant and so nice about everything and understanding.  
I would like to mention the doctor on last night I think she was called Nicola.  
I have no improvements.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Murph66
title: Stent removal following kidney infection
body:
I caught Covid at the start of February. It felt like a heavy cold and sore throat. Towards day 6 had severe swollen knee and joint pain. My GP prescribed me strong arthritic medication (over the phone) on the Friday (day 9) on the basis I went in for bloods on the Monday. By Sunday I was in excruciating pain and went to Monklands hospital where they found kidney stones had blocked my urethra and they quickly put a stent in. My infection markers were nearly 400, high blood SATS and they discovered sepsis. Infection spread into my chest and blood cultures were taken to fight infection in kidney. This went on for two weeks in hospital.  
I was released with oral antibiotics and told the hospital would be in touch to arrange stent removal and kidney stones lasers. After a week being out I had a flare up of joint pain in my ankle and pain in bladder area. I went to the hospital where they found I had a UTI which they treated with antibiotics. I was kept in for a week. On release I was told I would receive a letter regarding the stent removal. I tried to contact the hospital several times to no avail. I now have another UTI with more antibiotics and am in constant pain and discomfort.  
I managed to speak to a GP today who has written to the hospital regarding the stent which has now been in for over 9 weeks now and seems to be causing recurring infection. I never received a letter from the hospital to help me contact the correct department. They don‚Äôt have my details is what I have been told. Shouldn‚Äôt the hospital be contacting me to have this removed so the stones can be removed also? Who is monitoring my infection levels and the effectiveness of the antibiotics? Why am I not on the system? I feel very badly let down and alone. I am in constant discomfort and can‚Äôt get well as I am having recurring infections caused by the stent.

author: Pamela Mc
title: Outstanding care for my mother in law
body:
I just want to thank all staff in Ward 5 at Wishaw General Hospital. The care my mother in law received during her stay was faultless.  
Sadly my mother in Law passed away.  
The last week of her life, all staff were just amazing to both my mother in law and to us. It was such a hard time but nothing was ever too much bother. They were so accommodating.  
All the staff deserve the recognition. Amazing team work throughout the full ward.  
Thank you ward 5 for looking after her in her final journey.

author: Maysie
title: A team of wonderful , friendly professional people
body:
Our elderly mother had been found unresponsive by her carers and was taken to Antrim Area Hospital. I was advised to get my brother home as soon as possible. I was allowed to remain with my mum and received great support in Resuscitation despite A&E being hectic and under resourced. The Intensive Care Doctor advised that Mum would not be able to stick their intervention and care and CCU would be the best option.  
I work in quality assurance of Professional performance in another industry. I do not use the word outstanding lightly or often.  
There is however no other word to describe this amazing ward and all it‚Äôs staff.  
The standard of care was exceptional and Mum made a remarkable recovery and is now in a private nursing home.  
The CCU staff treated Mum with respect and dignity and were very supportive to my brother and me in every way possible.  
Very special people work very hard in this ward and we would like to extend a huge thank you and award performance as OUTSTANDING.  
Mum was moved to B3 awaiting discharge to a nursing home. While I have no complaints about nursing care, this ward lacks the reassuring ambience of CCU. Mum was anxious during her stay in B3 because of minor issues having experienced excellence in CCU where she felt safe.  
Discharge from B3 was poor, resulting in obstacles being presented to our mother‚Äôs move to a nursing home subsequent to discharge. This was mainly due to poor administration . Discharge felt like as long as she was gone from B3 they didn‚Äôt care what happened next.  
This was unlike CCU who talked to her and us helping to prepare her for a permanent bed in the nursing home of her choice.  
My mother had been seriously ill and was assessed as needing 24 hour nursing care yet a male member of staff offered an ultimatum that she went that day to a particular nursing home or she was left home where there no care package in place.  
Mum would not have agreed to discharge at that point as it presented a temporary bed instead of smooth discharge to her choice of home. It also caused double up of isolation periods etc at a traumatic time when she was dealing with not returning to her own home again. On reflection this was unacceptable treatment of a vulnerable adult.  
That said from paramedics in her home to each individual person who took care of her Thank You.  
Antrim Area hospital is very clean and well presented. Every effort is taken to ensure safety of everyone including visitors.  
From receptionist to support staff met on corridor all were helpful and caring.  
No words can express our gratitude for Mums remarkable recovery which was mainly down to CCU .  
My overall comment on CCU is a team of wonderful , friendly professional people who are well managed with an evident people over policy approach. Outstanding!

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My care has been 100 percent
body: My care has been 100 percent ever since I arrived in the hospital and is something I have been overjoyed about. The nursing has been incredible and they always take such good care as well as being so attentive with me getting me everything I may need. The doctors are just the same and have made my condition very easy to understand. The food is surprisingly very good bad I always get enough to eat which is something I can be grateful for. I am currently awaiting my results and am eager to be discharged

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Inconsistent care
body: My care so far in the hospital has mainly been 50-50. At times I feel like there is a lack of consistency as it feels like the nurses that are assigned to me and my block change every couple of hours which can sometimes be hard to adjust to. The nurses are good I just struggle with the consistency. The doctors are alright but I sadly do not see them enough and might only get a 5 minute consultation every couple of days. The food has been absolutely great so far and I always get enough despite my restricted diet. The place has been cleaned exceptionally well by the domestics. I have no other issues and am still incredibly grateful for the care I have received

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Pccareman
title: My wife's care
body:
Friends today I want to share my experiences of my wife and my journey, as my wife had myeloma cancer.  
In April 2021 she started her treatment in our local hospital. As the weeks went by her local consultant talked about meds and treatment. One of the meds was for constipation. This medicine was supposed to be changed. It was supplied by our local hospital by our local consultant. When we arrived home the meds for constipation was the same. I realised that our local consultant hadn't checked her medical notes?  
There was a few times my wife was taken to our local hospital for treatment and scans. One particular night my wife phoned me and said she needed to go to the toilet. I said to press the assistant button by the side of your bed. She said she couldn't as she was locked in a store room.  
Friends, we were personally disgusted at some of our so-called local hospital care and after home palliative care. As she was going through all the different cycles of treatment we kept our medical system up to date with her sickness, pains etc each day and week.  
In August her local consultant phoned to have a conversation about her illness. She was assured treatment was working and going well. Three nights later she went to go to bathroom the power of her legs left her. She was brought in to hospital and by Sunday morning she was paralysed. Her consultant said that they could not understand why her treatment stopped working.  
Friends, I am no doctor but full blood counts show a lot of TL Cells etc. Full blood tests were done. One minute the treatment was going to continue and then the next it was withdrawn. So sadly, we got the bad news nothing more can be done.  
I had my wife home for 13 weeks in the living room. I had to explain to nurses and carers that she had two fractures, one on each shoulder, and was paralysed. It came across to me that no one read her medical notes. If they had of, they would have known. The local nurse asked me could my wife do without a Catheter. I was informed that they don't have time to read her medical notes. How can anyone care for a person if they don't know what wrong? I even requested extra-large bed pads, but I was informed they only get what's available. That‚Äôs unreal and unbelievable.  
I requested a urine test because the strong smell of the urine and its colour indicated an infection. I was informed by our local nurse that our local GP said he didn't want to do one so basically he refused a urine test.  
A week later she becomes very unwell and had to go into our local hospital for treatment of Urosepsis. Seven hours later I received a medical phone call saying they are stopping the special drug. I said that she wasn't getting much of a chance just seven hours? Of course, I was advised that she had got cancer. I said my wife is in for the treatment of Urosepsis. At that time her cancer levels were normal.  
I have had a poor experience of the medical system from day one. We requested a simple hair wash. Three weeks later she asked when is her hair going to get washed? I said love I will do it myself she smiled and said thank you.  
Friends has anyone went through a similar experience of being let down by the system as we were? Hopefully your will have had a much-needed hair wash and simple things like dry hygiene wipes. We didn‚Äôt get those basic but essential things.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: dollycat47
title: GPOOH, 999 call handler and ambulance crew
body: Unfortunately I dont have all the staff names who helped us as it was a very stressful time.  My father-in-law became unwell, we called the out of hours GP service and had an almost immediate call back from a kind and caring GP - he also called back later that evening to check on things even though he had called an ambulance to come out to us/take over the care.  Whilst waiting on this my father in law deteriorated, we therefore called 999 services who remained calm and talked us through everything until the ambulances arrived.  The 2 crews that came were professional, respectful and so courteous to us.  One was called Stevie, sorry I am unsure of the ladies and 2 other gentlmens names. We are so appreciative of the care they gave my father in law and the dignity that they maintained for him at the time of his passing.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: bluemj69
title: Patient de-registration
body:
I was a patient with my local medical practice and they de-registered me from their practice. I was put into temporary accommodation by Renfrewshire council back in October 2021. I told the practice that this was temporary, and their admin told me that was outwith their catchment area. I only needed their support until I was put in permanent accommodation as I suffer from severe mental health problems. I was taking daily tablets and admin said that they were unable to help me. When I went to get my tablets I was told by the chemist that my serial prescription had expired as I was de-registered.  
I was left without tablets and the practice did not appear to care and spoke to me in an obnoxious way on the phone.  
I am in my fifties and I have never heard anything as disgusting as this, considering they are supposed to be there for me as a patient. Why do admin in doctors surgeries behave in an arrogant and disrespectful way - it is not as if they are doctors.  
I had been with this practice since 2016 and think I only ever seen a doctor once and that was for my first appointment (induction). I feel this place needs seriously looked at because if you go to their reviews it really doesn't paint a good picture.  
I am now registered with another practice. This surgery are so helpful and accommodating that I could not speak more highly of them.  
I feel totally let down by the NHS and I would be happy to die on the street than be seen by a practice like this.

author: stroker
title: Long wait for stroke treatment
body:
I was living at home alone and felt dizzy and weak when going to the toilet at 06:40 last week. I returned to bed and recovered somewhat so went downstairs , made a cup of tea and went back upstairs. I became increasingly faint and disorientated. Having had an earlier stroke, I was concerned that it was repeating although no muscular symptoms at this stage. I suspected either stroke or heart problem.  
I phoned 111, which was useless so phoned 999. I was told there was a wait of some 4 hrs for an ambulance. I phoned a neighbour who drove me to Grantham hospital A&E, which had just opened.  
I received excellent and prompt attention, including ECG and CT scan. By this stage, my left eye became uncontrollable and I had numbness of my left cheek, and extreme disorientation; also shallow and rapid breathing which I could not control.  
I was transferred by ambulance to Lincoln County Hospital, arriving at approx 10:00. A further ECG was taken by ambulance crew en-route. Despite remonstrations by ambulance staff seeking urgent care for stroke I had to go into Lincoln A&E for assessment, as this was apparently the quickest way to get admission to the Stroke Unit.  
I was seen by a doctor after some 1.5 to 2 hrs, who confirmed likely stroke, causing balance, vision and nausea problems, caused by a clot which would not have shown on the CT. I was given a large aspirin and held awaiting a bed on the stroke unit. Finally taken to stroke unit at approx 22:45.  
Once on the stroke unit, care and treatment was carried out to perfection, and my condition improved apace. OT and physio assessments fully and timely performed. I had a MRI scan, and was discharged with ongoing medication last Friday, with follow-up review in 6 - 8 weeks.  
I can only praise both Grantham A&E and Lincoln Stroke Unit for their care and attention. However, it could not be clearer to see that the time taken to get treatment was excessive and the lack of timely ambulance home service was unacceptable. With such shortage of resources at Lincoln County, the expanding population in the Grantham area, and delays in transportation, the Stroke Unit at Grantham should be reinstated as a matter of urgency.

title: Impossible to get appoinment
body: I called at 8am received a call back at 10.30 saying there were no appointments, I asked to see the out of hours GP and they told me to fill out a form after 2pm. I changed my answers to this form multiple times in order to "pass the test" but still couldn't get it to submit my request for an appointment only telling me to "seek medical advice" which is exactly what I was attempting to do! So I called the GP back at 14.30 its now 15.22 and I'm 15th in the queue. Extremely understaffed this needs to be fixed. When I do speak to a doctor they are too lazy to assess me themselves and send me to A and E where theres a 12 hour wait to be seen. Its simply not feasible to use this GP practice unless you are unemployed.

author: rhinocw84
title: My counsellor worked closely with me
body:
When I requested CBT for emotional eating I didn‚Äôt realise it would unravel a multitude of issues. My counsellor worked closely with me dealing with one thing at a time. Reinforcing all the discussions with practice sheets questions and answers and ongoing work for me to reinforce my newly learnt thinking and strategies. 
I felt extremely low and vulnerable. 
After my sessions I have a new found strength and find the paperwork and notes a valuable resource to remind my of the strategies I have learnt.

title: Great Practice
body:
I called in the morning left a mess with reception I had a call at lunchtime from the GP
I was seen by the GP late afternoon
1st class service

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: I am thankful of the care I am receiving.
body:
Daisy ward is really good everything we need is in the room, the en-suite and TV are great.  
The staff are very good and helpful, I have nothing negative to say about them. Every single staff member has been lovely, especially when they are so quiet checking on my daughter at night time as to not wake her. They also are so good they constantly are offering tea, coffee and water which I think is a nice touch.  
I have to say that the nurse on Monday night called Sarah was outstanding she deserves a lot of praise.  
I am thankful of the care I am receiving.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Very poor appointment system
body: Last 3 days i am traying to make appointment.they open 8.30, i wait 1 hour on the phone and every time they say no appointment available call back tomorrow. It seems it impossible to make appointment. I will change my gp because this system

author: S69
title: Private Consultant Gastroenterologist at Ross Hall Hospital
body: I had the pleasure of seeing Dr Heydtmann again today at Ross Hall. My current Consultant had left me feeling like i was not being listened to and basically told me there was nothing he could do for me. This discussion had left me feeling more anxious so i decided to reach out to the only person i knew i could trust with my health and that was Dr Heydtmann. After several emails it was decided it was best that i saw Dr Heydtmann for a face to face consultation. Dr Heydtmann was his usual friendly self and it was nice to be immediately put at ease. The consultation was thorough and everything was explained to me and i was allowed to voice any concerns or ask questions. I was given a few possible solutions to my situation and they were explained to me. I was so pleased that there was the possibility of a treatment for my problem. I always feel happier and relieved after seeing Dr Hydtmann as he always gives me good advice and a possible solution.

title: Fantastic Surgery
body: Thank you to everyone who works so tirelessly at the Beacon Surgery. You have continued to take care of your patients throughout such a difficult time. I always get an appointment when I need one, if I have something wrong that warrants a call, this happens very quickly and efficiently. The GP's are all really lovely and thorough and the Reception team are kind and doing the very best that they can. They do not have magic wands to create appointments out of thin air and deserve respect. I know, I have worked in a GP surgery and the Beacon is doing a great job. Thank you also to all the nurses, HCA's and other specialist staff there. Well done and keep on going, you are doing a fantastic job?

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: They are always here when you need them
body:
I came in with my twin sons, one was admitted through accident and emergency and the other through the GP referral. Accident and emergency was quick enough I was quite surprised at the pace. I was very happy with the care down there.  
Up here in the daisy ward it is very good, I cannot complain about the care it is of a very high standard. I am so thankful.  
The staff here are helpful, they make you feel like a priority. To help me the nurses took them for a walk or allowed me even to go and get a coffee for a 5 minute break! I have no bad words they are always here when you need them you do not need to ask twice.  
I cannot thank all of the staff enough there was so many even the domestic staff were outstanding.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great practice
body: Generally get a quick response when asking for an appt, followed up regularly as a diabetic. Staff are polite and understanding. Gps pay attention and advise well.

title: Dreadful Service
body:
I have been unable to see an actual GP for myself or my children for months. GP's only work select days and you are asked to make appointments only on days your GP is working as if illness respects GP's diaries. I have been told to go privately by the practice for one of my children which I can't afford. Prescriptions have been sent to the pharmacy without telling me while I wait for a call back to tell me whether we are getting a prescription which never comes. Or they don't get sent at all and I have to keep calling to see what is happening. The reception team add tasks to GP's lists which GP's don't always action and so you are left in limbo waiting for contact that may or ma not come. 
Medication is prescribed over the phone without ever seeing the patient. 
I don't trust the advice we are given anymore because we have ongoing issues that have yet to be seen by a GP or treated successfully. I feel like health conditions are left to get worse because the GP's will not see us so we end up going to minor injuries when infections get too bad or develop into more serious things. I just want trustworthy medical advice and treatment for my children but can't afford to go privately.

title: Our wonderful NHS
body: I have just had a colonoscopy and gastroscopy and Royal Bournemouth Hospital Endoscopy department. These staff members are all a credit to the NHS, a wonderful service delivered with care and compassion. Many thanks to you all. Karen

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust
